creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: wine pot, Cadogan type with celadon glaze and peachblossom splash
text: This pot, without a lid, is filled from the bottom. Europeans probably considered such pots curiosities rather than useful vessels. "Cadogan" refers to the earl of Cadogan, who in the early nineteenth century promoted the use of such peach-shaped pots for serving tea.
title: “Cadogan” teapot
